org.openadaptor.core.node
Class Node

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.core.Component
      org.openadaptor.core.lifecycle.LifecycleComponent
          org.openadaptor.core.node.Node
All Implemented Interfaces:
Administrable, IComponent, ILifecycleComponent, IMessageProcessor
Direct Known Subclasses:
EnrichmentProcessorNode, ProcessorNode, ReadNode, WriteNode
public class Node
extends LifecycleComponent
implements IMessageProcessor

The class which brings together the IMessageProcessor and ILifecycleComponent interfaces. Specific data processing is actually delegated to an IDataProcessor but the Node is responsbile for the following

  • propogation of lifecycle management to the IDataProcessor
  • data un-batching
  • transaction enlisting
  • exception capture
  • discard capture

    This allows implementations of IDataProcessor, IReadConnector, IWriteConnector and IEnrichmentProcessor to be as lightweight as possible and free from the specifics of the adaptor framework.
    It is also possible to "chain" a Node to another IMessageProcessor, this is how ReadNodes initiate new message processing. This is different from ProcessorNodes and WriteNode which process Messages.

    Author:
    perryj
    See Also:
    Adaptor, Router

    processSingleRecord

    protected java.lang.Object[] processSingleRecord(java.lang.Object record)
    Processes individual record of input data. This was put in a separate method since some Nodes (that extend from this one) may want to do it in a different way.

    Parameters:
    record - input record
    Returns:
    result from the processor.
